info.title: Member API v2
info.description: Member API is API which can be used by client application like SPA.

get.description: Get server current time, in seconds since Unix epoch.

200.description: Get server current time, in seconds since Unix epoch.

get.description: Returns list of member levels and the privileges they provide.

200.description: Returns list of member levels and the privileges they provide.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btcusd'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

get.description: Get OHLC(k line) of specific market.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btcusd'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Time period of K line, default to 1. You can choose between 1, 5, 15, 30, 60, 120, 240, 360, 720, 1440, 4320, 10080

parameters.name: time_from
parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch. If set, only k-line data after that time will be returned.

parameters.name: time_to
parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch. If set, only k-line data till that time will be returned.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned data points default to 30. Ignored if time_from and time_to are given.

200.description: Get OHLC(k line) of specific market.

get.description: Get depth or specified market. Both asks and bids are sorted from highest price to lowest.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btcusd'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned price levels. Default to 300.

200.description: Get depth or specified market. Both asks and bids are sorted from highest price to lowest.

get.description: Get recent trades on market, each trade is included only once. Trades are sorted in reverse creation order.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btcusd'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned trades. Default to 50.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch. If set, only trades executed before the time will be returned.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Trade id. If set, only trades created after the trade will be returned.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Trade id. If set, only trades created before the trade will be returned.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: If set, returned trades will be sorted in specific order, default to 'desc'.

200.description: Get recent trades on market, each trade is included only once. Trades are sorted in reverse creation order.

get.description: Get the order book of specified market.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btcusd'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

parameters.name: asks_limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned sell orders. Default to 20.

parameters.name: bids_limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned buy orders. Default to 20.

200.description: Get the order book of specified market.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Currency type

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Currency code.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency code.

get.description: Returns deposit address for account you want to deposit to by currency. The address may be blank because address generation process is still in progress. If this case you should try again later.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The account you want to deposit to.

parameters.name: address_format
parameters.description: Address format legacy/cash

200.description: Returns deposit address for account you want to deposit to by currency. The address may be blank because address generation process is still in progress. If this case you should try again later.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency value contains bch,btc,dash,eth,ltc,trst,usd,xrp,BCH,BTC,DASH,ETH,LTC,TRST,USD,XRP

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Set result limit.

get.description: List your withdraws as paginated collection.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Any supported currencies: bch,btc,dash,eth,ltc,trst,usd,xrp,BCH,BTC,DASH,ETH,LTC,TRST,USD,XRP.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (defaults to 1).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of withdraws per page (defaults to 100, maximum is 1000).

200.description: List your withdraws as paginated collection.

get.description: Get your executed trades. Trades are sorted in reverse creation order.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btcusd'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned trades. Default to 50.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch. If set, only trades executed before the time will be returned.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Trade id. If set, only trades created after the trade will be returned.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Trade id. If set, only trades created before the trade will be returned.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: If set, returned trades will be sorted in specific order, default to 'desc'.

200.description: Get your executed trades. Trades are sorted in reverse creation order.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: If present, only sell orders (asks) or buy orders (bids) will be canncelled.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique order id.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btcusd'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: Either 'sell' or 'buy'.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: The amount user want to sell/buy. An order could be partially executed, e.g. an order sell 5 btc can be matched with a buy 3 btc order, left 2 btc to be sold; in this case the order's volume would be '5.0', its remaining_volume would be '2.0', its executed volume is '3.0'.

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: Price for each unit. e.g. If you want to sell/buy 1 btc at 3000 usd, the price is '3000.0'

get.description: Get your orders, results is paginated.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btcusd'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Filter order by state, default to "wait" (active orders).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned orders, default to 100.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specify the page of paginated results.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: If set, returned orders will be sorted in specific order, default to "asc".

200.description: Get your orders, results is paginated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique order id.

post.description: Returns server time in seconds since Unix epoch.

201.description: Returns server time in seconds since Unix epoch.

put.description: «process» – system will lock the money, check for suspected activity, validate recipient address, and initiate the processing of the withdraw. «cancel»  – system will mark withdraw as «canceled», and unlock the money.

parameters.name: tid
parameters.description: The shared transaction ID.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to perform.

post.description: Creates new withdraw. The behaviours for fiat and crypto withdraws are different. Fiat: money are immediately locked, withdraw state is set to «submitted», system workers will validate withdraw later against suspected activity, and assign state to «rejected» or «accepted». The processing will not begin automatically. The processing may be initiated manually from admin panel or by PUT /management_api/v1/withdraws/action. Coin: money are immediately locked, withdraw state is set to «submitted», system workers will validate withdraw later against suspected activity, validate withdraw address and

parameters.name: uid
parameters.description: The shared user ID.

parameters.name: tid
parameters.description: The shared transaction ID. Must not exceed 64 characters. Peatio will generate one automatically unless supplied.

parameters.name: rid
parameters.description: The beneficiary ID or wallet address on the Blockchain.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency code.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount to withdraw.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to perform.

parameters.name: tid
parameters.description: The shared transaction ID.

parameters.name: uid
parameters.description: The shared user ID.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency code.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number (defaults to 1).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of objects per page (defaults to 100, maximum is 1000).

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The state to filter by.

put.description: Allows to load money or cancel deposit.

parameters.name: tid
parameters.description: The shared transaction ID.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The new state to apply.

200.description: Allows to load money or cancel deposit.

post.description: Creates new fiat deposit with state set to «submitted». Optionally pass field «state» set to «accepted» if want to load money instantly. You can also use PUT /fiat_deposits/:id later to load money or cancel deposit.

parameters.name: uid
parameters.description: The shared user ID.

parameters.name: tid
parameters.description: The shared transaction ID. Must not exceed 64 characters. Peatio will generate one automatically unless supplied.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency code.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The deposit amount.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The state of deposit.

201.description: Creates new fiat deposit with state set to «submitted». Optionally pass field «state» set to «accepted» if want to load money instantly. You can also use PUT /fiat_deposits/:id later to load money or cancel deposit.

parameters.name: tid
parameters.description: The transaction ID.

parameters.name: uid
parameters.description: The shared user ID.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency code.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number (defaults to 1).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of deposits per page (defaults to 100, maximum is 1000).

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The state to filter by.

post.description: Queries the account balance for the given UID and currency.

parameters.name: uid
parameters.description: The shared user ID.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency code.

201.description: Queries the account balance for the given UID and currency.

rid.description: The beneficiary ID or wallet address on the Blockchain.

state.description: The withdraw state. «prepared» – initial state, money are not locked. «submitted» – withdraw has been allowed by outer service for further validation, money are locked. «canceled» – withdraw has been canceled by outer service, money are unlocked. «accepted» – system has validated withdraw and queued it for processing by worker, money are locked. «rejected» – system has validated withdraw and found errors, money are unlocked. «suspected» – system detected suspicious activity, money are unlocked. «processing» – worker is processing withdraw as the current moment, money are locked. «succeed» – worker has successfully processed withdraw, money are subtracted from the account. «failed» – worker has encountered an unhandled error while processing withdraw, money are unlocked.

created_at.description: The datetime when withdraw was created.

blockchain_txid.description: The transaction ID on the Blockchain (coin only).

state.description: The deposit state. «submitted» – initial state. «canceled» – deposit has been canceled by outer service. «rejected» – deposit has been rejected by outer service.. «accepted» – deposit has been accepted by outer service, money are loaded.

created_at.description: The datetime when deposit was created.

completed_at.description: The datetime when deposit was completed.

blockchain_txid.description: The transaction ID on the Blockchain (coin only).

blockchain_confirmations.description: The number of transaction confirmations on the Blockchain (coin only).

Balance.description: Queries the account balance for the given UID and currency.
